cipher_jer2240.cipherpkg

Module Contents

Functions

cipher(text, shift[, encrypt])

Encrypts or decrypts a Caeser cipher.
cipher_jer2240.cipherpkg.cipher(text, shift, encrypt=True)[source]

Encrypts or decrypts a Caeser cipher.

Parameters

  • text (string) – Input string to be either encrypted or decrypted.

  • shift (integer) – Integer value indicating the alphabet shift for the replacement. Can be positive for negative.

  • encrypt (bool) – Boolean value determining whether the function encrypts or decrypts ‘text’. Defaults to ‘True’, use false to decrypt.

Returns

The encrypted or decrypted ‘text’.

Return type

string

Examples

Encryption:

>>> from cipher_jer2240 import cipherpkg
>>> cipherpkg.cipher('text', 5, encrypt = True)
'yjCy'

Decryption: >>> from cipher_jer2240 import cipherpkg >>> cipherpkg.cipher(‘yjCy’, 5, encrypt = False) ‘text’
